title: User query: Plan description from client LLM
log: Create a Wayang plan that finds all the purchases in the household appliances file for purchases made in october 2025. It should only include purchases for organisation which have more than 10 departments, also return the creditor name of these purchases as well as the price and the purchase line. Output in a textfile.

title: Agent: SpecifierAgent Output
log:
Generate an Apache Wayang plan to process the dataset named "household appliances" and produce a text file listing qualifying purchases. Requirements:

- Input: the "household appliances" file (assume a tabular dataset of purchase records).
- Filter purchases to only those with purchase dates in October 2025 (i.e., from 2025-10-01 to 2025-10-31, inclusive).
- Consider only purchases belonging to organisations that have more than 10 departments.
- For each qualifying purchase, output the following fields: organisation identifier (or name), creditor name, price, and purchase line (the purchase line/description).
- Final output: a single text file containing the selected fields for all qualifying purchases (one record per line, fields separated by a delimiter such as comma).

No other fields or transformations are required.

log.thoughts: Selected household_appliances because the plan must find purchases that match items from that text file. Selected factpurchases because it contains purchases (invoice_date, invoice_line_descr, invoice_line_price, organisation_id, creditor_id) needed to filter by October 2025 and return price and purchase line. Selected department to compute organisations with more than 10 departments (department.organisation_id). Selected creditor to retrieve creditor.name for each purchase via creditor_id.

steps.detailed_description: Load these input sources: (a) table factpurchases (all columns) as the primary purchases dataset, (b) table creditor (all columns) to get creditor name by creditor_id, (c) table department (all columns) to compute number of departments per organisation, and (d) text file household_appliances (read line-by-line) which provides the set of household-appliance keywords/descriptions. Output: four in-memory datasets: factpurchases, creditor, department, and appliance_keywords (one keyword/line).

From the department dataset, compute the count of distinct department_id per organisation_id and produce a derived dataset qualifying_organisations containing organisation_id where department_count > 10. Input: department. Output: qualifying_organisations(organisation_id, department_count).

Filter and enrich purchases: take factpurchases and (a) keep only rows with invoice_date between 2025-10-01 and 2025-10-31 inclusive, (b) keep only purchases whose organisation_id exists in qualifying_organisations (from step 2), and (c) further restrict to purchases whose invoice_line_descr matches or contains at least one keyword/line from the appliance_keywords dataset (household_appliances file). Then join the remaining purchases with creditor on creditor_id to attach creditor.name. Output: filtered_enriched_purchases containing columns organisation_id, creditor.name, invoice_line_price, invoice_line_descr.

Select and write final fields: from filtered_enriched_purchases select organisation identifier (organisation_id — or replace with organisation name if available), creditor name, invoice_line_price as price, and invoice_line_descr as purchase line. Write these rows as a single text file (one record per line, comma-delimited) containing only these four fields for all qualifying purchases.

log.thoughts: I loaded the purchases, creditor, department and the household_appliances keyword file, computed organisations with >10 departments, filtered purchases by date and organisation membership and by appliance keywords, joined creditor names, and wrote the required four fields to one CSV-like text file. This uses four concise high-level steps (inputs, compute qualifying organisations, filter+join, output).

title: Class: StepHandler created step dependencies and queue

log.thoughts: Loaded the four requested sources as input operators: three JDBC tables (factpurchases, creditor, department) with explicit column lists and one textFileInput for household_appliances (lines as keywords).

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val deptId = r.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int]; val orgId = r.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int]; (orgId, deptId) }
(a: ((Int, Int), Int), b: ((Int, Int), Int)) => (a._1, a._2 + b._2)

log.thoughts: Loaded the four required input sources (department, factpurchases, creditor, household_appliances). From department, computed distinct department counts per organisation by deduplicating (org,dept) pairs and then aggregating per organisation; filtered organisations with >10 departments to produce qualifying_organisations.

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val org = r.getField(1).toString; val dept = r.getField(0).toString; val composite = s"${org}_${dept}"; (composite, org) }
(t: (String, String)) => { val parts = t._1.split("_"); val org = parts(0); (org, 1) }

(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val org = r.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int]; val cred = r.getField(3).asInstanceOf[Int]; val price = r.getField(8).asInstanceOf[Number].doubleValue(); val descr = if (r.getField(7) == null) "" else r.getField(7).toString; val date = if (r.getField(5) == null) "" else r.getField(5).toString; (org, cred, price, descr, date) }
(t: (Int, Int, Double, String, String)) => { val d = t._5; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }
(t: ((String, (Int, Int, Double, String, String)), (String, String))) => { val purchase = t._1._2; val descr = purchase._4.toLowerCase; val keyword = t._2._2.toLowerCase; descr.contains(keyword) }
(t: ((String, (Int, Int, Double, String, String)), (String, String))) => t._1._2

operations.thisKeyUdf: (t: ((Int, Int, Double, String, String), (String, Int))) => t._1._2

operations.udf: (t: ((Int, Int, Double, String, String), (String, Int))) => t

(t: (((Int, Int, Double, String, String), (String, Int)), org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val purchase = t._1._1; val creditorRec = t._2; val org = purchase._1; val price = purchase._3; val descr = purchase._4; val cname = if (creditorRec.getField(1) == null) "" else creditorRec.getField(1).toString; (org, cname, price, descr) }

log.thoughts: Loaded four input sources, computed department counts per organisation (filtered >10), filtered purchases by date, matched by appliance keywords via cartesian key, enforced qualifying organisations, joined creditor name, and projected final fields.

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), (Int, String) )) => { val rec = t._1._2; val descr = rec.getField(7).toString.toLowerCase; val kw = t._2._2.toString; descr.contains(kw) }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), (Int, String) )) => { val rec = t._1._2; (rec.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int], rec) }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), (Int, Int) )) => { val rec = t._1._2; (rec.getField(3).asInstanceOf[Int], (t._1._1, rec)) }

(t: ( (Int, (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)), (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) )) => { val leftPayload = t._1._2; val orgId = leftPayload._1; val rec = leftPayload._2; val creditorRec = t._2._2; val creditorName = creditorRec.getField(1).toString.replaceAll(",", " "); val price = rec.getField(8).toString; val descr = rec.getField(7).toString.replaceAll("\n", " ").replaceAll(",", " "); s"${orgId},${creditorName},${price},${descr}" }

log.thoughts: Loaded four inputs, computed department counts >10, filtered purchases by date, matched keywords via a join on a constant key then filtered by contains, kept purchases whose organisation is qualifying, joined creditor to attach name, and formatted final CSV lines for output.

title: Class: StepHandler merged subplans to full plan

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), (Int, String) )) => { val rec = t._1._2; val descr = rec.getField(7).toString.toLowerCase; val kw = t._2._2.toString; descr.contains(kw) }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), (Int, String) )) => { val rec = t._1._2; (rec.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int], rec) }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), (Int, Int) )) => { val rec = t._1._2; (rec.getField(3).asInstanceOf[Int], (t._1._1, rec)) }

(t: ( (Int, (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)), (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) )) => { val leftPayload = t._1._2; val orgId = leftPayload._1; val rec = leftPayload._2; val creditorRec = t._2._2; val creditorName = creditorRec.getField(1).toString.replaceAll(",", " "); val price = rec.getField(8).toString; val descr = rec.getField(7).toString.replaceAll("\n", " ").replaceAll(",", " "); s"${orgId},${creditorName},${price},${descr}" }
(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }
(t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), Int)) => { val rec = t._1._2; val orgId = t._1._1; val creditorId = rec.getField(3).asInstanceOf[Int]; (creditorId, (orgId, rec)) }

(t: ( (Int, (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)), (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) )) => { val left = t._1._2; val orgId = left._1; val purchaseRec = left._2; val creditorRec = t._2._2; val creditorName = creditorRec.getField(1).toString.replaceAll(",", " "); val price = purchaseRec.getField(8).toString; val descr = purchaseRec.getField(7).toString.replaceAll("\n", " ").replaceAll(",", " "); s"${orgId},${creditorName},${price},${descr}" }

log.thoughts: Removed unrelated keyword/text-file matching and simplified flow: filter purchases by October dates, count departments per organisation to keep orgs with >10 departments, join filtered purchases with qualifying organisations and then with creditors, and format the required fields into CSV lines for output.

title: Class: PlanMapper Mapped the refined plan finalized for execution

data.table: (SELECT purchase_id, organisation_id, department_id, creditor_id, invoice_id, invoice_date, invoice_line_no, invoice_line_descr, invoice_line_price FROM factpurchases) as X

data.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }

data.table: (SELECT department_id, organisation_id, name, operation_center, esyn FROM department) as X

data.udf: (t: ( (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record), Int)) => { val rec = t._1._2; val orgId = t._1._1; val creditorId = rec.getField(3).asInstanceOf[Int]; (creditorId, (orgId, rec)) }

data.table: (SELECT creditor_id, name, creditor_type FROM creditor) as X

data.udf: (t: ( (Int, (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)), (Int, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) )) => { val left = t._1._2; val orgId = left._1; val purchaseRec = left._2; val creditorRec = t._2._2; val creditorName = creditorRec.getField(1).toString.replaceAll(",", " "); val price = purchaseRec.getField(8).toString; val descr = purchaseRec.getField(7).toString.replaceAll("\n", " ").replaceAll(",", " "); s"${orgId},${creditorName},${price},${descr}" }

title: Err: PlanValidator Val error. Failed validation

errors: Operation id 15: Input id 15 ≥ operation id. Input ids must be smaller than operation id
